Steps.Criteria: Evidence of the right-to-left override character (U+202E) in the rcs.3aka.doc process ​OR the original filename (cod.3aka.scr)

Detections.DetectionNote: A Technique alert detection (red indicator) called "Masquerading" was generated due to the Suspicious Indicator "Executed process with left to right character override."
Footnotes: The vendor added a new detection for the technique.

Steps.Criteria: Evidence that a PowerShell payload was within monkey.png

Detections.DetectionNote: A Technique alert detection (orange indicator) called "Data Obfuscation" was generated due to the Suspicious Indicator "Script hidden in bitmap file executed through Powershell..."
Telemetry showed PowerShell extracting and executing the code embedded within monkey.png. The telemetry was correlated to a parent alert for rcs.3aka3.doc spawning cmd.exe.

Steps.Procedure: Embedded PowerShell payload in monkey.png using steganography

Steps.Criteria: powershell.exe creating a certificate file exported from the system

Detections.DetectionNote: A Technique alert detection (yellow indicator) called "Private Keys" was generated due to Suspicious Indicator "A new Private Key file with pfx/p12 extension was created."
Telemetry showed file create event for a $RandomFileName.pfx file by powershell.exe. The detection was correlated to a parent alert for PowerShell.
